full_text: Activity patterns are templates that standardize how activities are generated. They are typically managed by administrators. Log in as Super User. Go to the Administration tab. Select Business Settings, Activity Patterns. To view an existing activity pattern, click the name of the activity pattern in the list. For example, Get Credit Reports. Click Edit. Let's look at the fields on the Activity Pattern page. Short Subject is a brief description of the activity. Automated only indicates whether this pattern is not available for manually created activities and used only by rules and Gosu. Description specifies what is expected in the completion of this activity. Escalation days and hours specify how many days and hours before an activity will be escalated if not complete. Mandatory indicates whether you can skip this activity. The code field is a unique internal name for the pattern and is used to reference an activity pattern in Gosu. Recurring indicates whether the activity recurs on a regular schedule. Subject is the title of the activity pattern. Priority indicates the urgency of the activity. Type, Select General or Assignment Review. General activities are closed by being completed or skipped. Assignment Review Activity. The activities are added to a supervisor's pending assignment queue. Pattern Level indicates the levels at which the activity can be attached . Target Days and Hours are the target number of days and hours to complete this activity. Category. Category classifies patterns into related groups in the new activity screen action menu. Activity Class. Select Task or Event. A task can have a due date, but an event cannot. It is not. Escalation Start Point. Select when to begin calculating the escalation date or time. Target Start Point. Select when to begin calculating the target date. Escalation and target include days. Indicate whether to include business days or calendar days. Cancel the edit. Go back to the Activity Patterns page. To create a new activity pattern, click the New Activity Pattern button. It will be updated.  It will be updated. It will be updated. It will be updated. It will be updated.  It will be updated. It will be updated.    It will be updated. It will be updated.     It will be updated.    It will be updated.  It will be updated.

segments.text: Activity patterns are templates that standardize how activities are generated. They are typically managed by administrators. Log in as Super User. Go to the Administration tab. Select Business Settings, Activity Patterns. To view an existing activity pattern, click the name of the activity pattern in the list. For example, Get Credit Reports. Click Edit.

Let's look at the fields on the Activity Pattern page. Short Subject is a brief description of the activity. Automated only indicates whether this pattern is not available for manually created activities and used only by rules and Gosu. Description specifies what is expected in the completion of this activity. Escalation days and hours specify how many days and hours before an activity will be escalated if not complete.

Mandatory indicates whether you can skip this activity. The code field is a unique internal name for the pattern and is used to reference an activity pattern in Gosu. Recurring indicates whether the activity recurs on a regular schedule. Subject is the title of the activity pattern. Priority indicates the urgency of the activity. Type, Select General or Assignment Review. General activities are closed by being completed or skipped. Assignment Review Activity.
The activities are added to a supervisor's pending assignment queue.
Pattern Level indicates the levels at which the activity can be attached . Target Days and Hours are the target number of days and hours to complete this activity.
Category. Category classifies patterns into related groups in the new activity screen action menu.
Activity Class. Select Task or Event. A task can have a due date, but an event cannot.
Escalation Start Point. Select when to begin calculating the escalation date or time.
Target Start Point. Select when to begin calculating the target date.
Escalation and target include days. Indicate whether to include business days or calendar days.
Go back to the Activity Patterns page.
To create a new activity pattern, click the New Activity Pattern button.
